ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN

block.text: JON

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 1
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

block.text: Bipo bipo tru, taim olgeta samting i no kamap yet, Tok i stap. Tok i stap wantaim God na Tok em yet i God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same was in the beginning with God.

block.text: Bipo bipo tru Tok i stap wantaim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made.

block.text: Long dispela Tok tasol God i mekim kamap olgeta samting. Na i no gat wanpela samting i kamap long narapela rot. Nogat. Olgeta samting i kamap, em Tok yet i mekim kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In him was life, and the life was the light of men.

block.text: Laip i stap long em, na dispela laip em i lait bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn't overcome it.

block.text: Dispela lait i save lait i stap long tudak, na tudak i no bin daunim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.

block.text: Wanpela man i kamap, nem bilong en Jon. God i bin salim em i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same came as a witness, that he might testify about the light, that all might believe through him.

block.text: Em i kam bilong autim tok. Em i autim tok bilong dispela lait, bai olgeta manmeri i ken harim tok bilong em, na ol i ken bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was not the light, but was sent that he might testify about the light.

block.text: Em yet em i no dispela lait. Nogat. Em i kam bilong autim tok tasol bilong dispela lait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The true light that enlightens everyone was coming into the world.

block.text: Dispela lait em i lait tru na i save givim lait long olgeta manmeri, em i laik i kam long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn't recognize him.

block.text: Orait Tok em i stap long graun. Long dispela Tok tasol God i bin wokim graun, tasol ol manmeri bilong graun ol i no luksave long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to his own, and those who were his own didn't receive him.

block.text: Em i go long as ples bilong em yet, tasol ol lain bilong en ol i no kisim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But as many as received him, to them he gave the right to become God's children, to those who believe in his name.

block.text: Tasol sampela manmeri i kisim em, em ol lain i bilip long nem bilong em. Na em i givim namba long ol bai ol i ken kamap pikinini bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

block.text: Ol i no kamap pikinini bilong God long blut bilong papamama, o long laik bilong bodi, o long laik bilong man. Nogat. God yet i mekim ol i kamap pikinini bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Word became flesh, and lived among us. We saw his glory, such glory as of the only begotten Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.

block.text: Tok em i bin kamap man, na em i kam i stap namel long mipela. Mipela i lukim pinis bikpela namba na strong bilong em. Em i namba bilong dispela wanpela Pikinini tasol, Papa i salim em i kam. Marimari na pasin i tru i pulap long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John testified about him. He cried out, saying,

block.text: Jon i tokim ol manmeri long em na i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me, for he was before me.’”

block.text: "Em dispela man, bipo mi tokim yupela pinis long em. Mi bin tok olsem, 'Man i kam bihain long mi, em i namba wan bilong mi. Long wanem, em i stap bipo, taim mi no kamap yet.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: From his fullness we all received grace upon grace.

block.text: Marimari i pulap moa yet long dispela man, na long marimari bilong em, em i save mekim gut tru long yumi olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law was given through Moses. Grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.

block.text: I tru, God i givim lo long yumi long han bilong Moses. Tasol long Jisas Krais yumi kisim marimari wantaim pasin i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one has seen God at any time. The one and only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him.

block.text: I no gat wanpela man i bin lukim God. Nogat tru. Dispela wanpela Pikinini Bilong God, em yet i God na em i stap klostu tru long Papa, em wanpela tasol i bin soim God long yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is John's testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him,

block.text: Ol Juda i salim ol pris na Livai na ol i lusim Jerusalem na i kam askim Jon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you?”

block.text: "Yu husat tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He did not fail to declare, but declared freely,

block.text: Orait Jon i autim tok olsem. Em i tokaut klia na i no haitim tok. Em i tokaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not the Christ.”

block.text: "Mi no dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Na ol i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What then? Are you Elijah?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Ating yu Elaija, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not.”

block.text: "Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked:
“Are you the prophet?”

block.text: "Ating yu dispela profet mipela i wetim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Ol i tok, Na em I bekim tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No.”

block.text: "Nogat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Olsem na ol i askim em gen,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”

block.text: "Yu husat tru? Mipela i mas bekim wanpela tok long ol man i bin salim mipela i kam. Yu tok wanem long yu yet?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Orait na Jon i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”

block.text: "Mi dispela 'maus bilong wanpela man i stap long ples i no gat man na i singaut olsem, "Stretim rot bilong Bikpela."' Em i olsem bipo profet Aisaia i bin tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees.
They asked him,

block.text: Ol Farisi i bin salim ol dispela man i kam.
Na ol i askim Jon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?”

block.text: "Sapos yu no dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en, na yu no Elaija, na yu no dispela profet, orait watpo yu save givim baptais long ol manmeri?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered them,

block.text: Jon i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I baptize in water, but among you stands one whom you don't know.

block.text: "Mi save baptaisim ol long wara. Tasol i gat wanpela man i stap namel long yupela, na yupela i no save long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is the one who comes after me, who is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I'm not worthy to loosen.”

block.text: Em i dispela man i kam bihain long mi. Mi yet mi no gutpela man inap long mi lusim string i pasim su bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These things were done in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

block.text: Jon i bin mekim dispela tok long ples Betani, long hapsait bilong wara Jordan. Long dispela ples Jon i save givim baptais long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said,

block.text: Long de bihain, Jon i lukim Jisas i wokabaut i kam long em. Na Jon i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

block.text: "Lukim. Em i Pikinini Sipsip Bilong God. Em i kam bilong tekewe sin bilong olgeta manmeri bilong graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is preferred before me, for he was before me.’

block.text: Em dispela man tasol bipo mi bin tok long en olsem, 'Man i kam bihain long mi, em i namba wan bilong mi. Long wanem, em i stap bipo, taim mi no kamap yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I didn't know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: that he would be revealed to Israel.”

block.text: Mi yet mi no bin save long em i husat tru. Tasol mi kam baptaisim ol man long wara bai ol manmeri bilong Israel i ken save long dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: John testified, saying,

block.text: Na Jon i tokaut moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove out of heaven, and it remained on him.

block.text: "Mi lukim pinis Holi Spirit i lusim heven na i kam daun olsem wanpela bilong ol dispela pisin ol i kolim balus, na em i go i stap antap long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I didn't recognize him, but he who sent me to baptize in water, he said to me, ‘On whomever you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’

block.text: Mi yet mi no bin save long em. Tasol God i bin salim mi na mi kam bilong baptaisim ol manmeri long wara, bipo em i bin tokim mi olsem, 'Taim yu lukim Holi Spirit i kam daun na i stap long wanpela man, orait em dispela man tasol i kam bilong baptaisim ol manmeri long Holi Spirit.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”

block.text: Na mi yet mi lukim na mi autim tok pinis olsem, dispela em i Pikinini Bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, the next day, John was standing with two of his disciples.

block.text: Long de bihain, Jon i sanap i stap gen na tupela disaipel bilong en i sanap wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked at Jesus as he walked, and said,

block.text: Na em i lukim Jisas i wokabaut i go. Na Jon i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the Lamb of God!”

block.text: "Lukim. Em i Pikinini Sipsip Bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the two disciples heard him speak they followed Jesus.

block.text: Dispela tupela disaipel i harim em i mekim dispela tok, na tupela i go bihainim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus turned, and saw them following, and said to them,

block.text: Jisas i tanim na i lukim tupela i bihainim em i kam, na em i askim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you looking for?”

block.text: "Yutupela i painim wanem samting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Na tupela i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi”

block.text: "Rabai,

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which is to say, being interpreted, Teacher),

block.text: Dispela nem "Rabai" em i olsem, "Tisa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “where are you staying?”

block.text: yu stap long wanem haus?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come, and see.”

block.text: "Yutupela kam lukim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. It was about the tenth hour.

block.text: Orait tupela i go na i lukim haus em i stap long en. Na long dispela de tupela i stap wantaim em. Long wanem, em i olsem 4 klok long apinun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the two who heard John, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.

block.text: Andru, em brata bilong Saimon Pita, em i wanpela bilong dispela tupela man i harim tok bilong Jon na i go bihainim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He first found his own brother, Simon, and said to him,

block.text: Em i lusim Jisas pinis, orait em i go stret na painim brata bilong en Saimon, na em i tokim Saimon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have found the Messiah!”

block.text: "Mipela i lukim pinis Mesaia."

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which means, Christ).
He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him, and said,

block.text: Dispela nem "Mesaia" em i olsem," Man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en."
Na Andru I bringim Saimon i go long Jisas. Jisas i lukim em na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas.”

block.text: "Yu Saimon, pikinini bilong Jon. Bihain bai ol i kolim yu long nem Sifas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which is by interpretation, Peter).

block.text: Dispela nem "Sifas" em i wankain olsem "Pita." Mining bilong en i olsem, "Ston."

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him,

block.text: Long de bihain, Jisas i laik i go long Galili. Na em i go painim Filip, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: "Yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.

block.text: Filip em i man bilong taun Betsaida, em as ples bilong Andru tupela Pita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip found Nathanael, and said to him,

block.text: Orait Filip i go painim Nataniel na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”

block.text: "Mipela I lukim pinis dispela man bipo Moses i bin raitim tok bilong em long buk bilong lo, na ol profet tu i bin raitim tok bilong em. Em Jisas bilong taun Nasaret, em pikinini bilong Josep."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nathanael said to him,

block.text: Na Nataniel i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?”

block.text: "Ating wanpela gutpela samting em inap kamap long Nasaret, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip said to him,

block.text: Na Filip i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and see.”

block.text: "Yu kam lukim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said about him,

block.text: Jisas i lukim Nataniel I kam long em, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”

block.text: "Lukim. Dispela man i kam, em i man tru bilong Israel. I no gat wanpela giaman tok o giaman pasin i stap long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nathanael said to him,

block.text: Na Nataniel i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How do you know me?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na yu save long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

block.text: "Taim Filip i no singautim yu yet, mi lukim yu i stap long as bilong diwai fik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nathanael answered him,

block.text: Nataniel i harim dispela tok na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are King of Israel!”

block.text: "Tisa, yu Pikinini Bilong God. Yu King bilong Israel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because I told you, ‘I saw you underneath the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these!”

block.text: "Mi tokim yu olsem mi lukim yu i stap long as bilong diwai fik, na long dispela as tasol yu bilip long mi. Bihain bai yu lukim ol bikpela samting i winim tru dispela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, hereafter you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, bihain bai yupela i lukim heven i op, na bai yupela i lukim ol ensel bilong God i go antap na i kam daun long Pikinini Bilong Man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 2
The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there.

block.text: Tupela de bihain long Jisas i singautim Filip wantaim Nataniel, wanpela man i marit long taun Kana long distrik Galili. Na mama bilong Jisas i go lukim dispela marit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage.

block.text: Ol i bin singautim tu Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en, na ol tu i kam i stap long dispela marit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him,

block.text: Taim wain i pinis, na mama bilong Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have no wine.”

block.text: "Ol i no gat wain."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Dear woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.”

block.text: "Mama, dispela em i samting bilong yu. Em i no samting bilong mi. Taim bilong mi em i no yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother said to the servants,

block.text: Orait mama bilong en i tokim ol wokman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whatever he says to you, do it.”

block.text: "Sapos em I tokim yupela long mekim wanpela samting, orait yupela i mas mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there were six water pots of stone set there after the Jews’ way of purifying, containing two or three metretes apiece.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Long dispela haus i gat 6 -pela bikpela sospen ston i stap, bilong ol Juda i ken waswas long pasin bilong ol. Wanpela wanpela inap holim samting olsem 100 lita wara.
Orait Jisas i tokim ol wokman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Fill the water pots with water.”

block.text: "Pulimapim wara long ol sospen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They filled them up to the brim.
He said to them,

block.text: Na ol i pulapim ol tru.
Na em i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast.”

block.text: "Kisim sampela nau na karim i go long man i bosim kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took it.
When the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and didn't know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast called the bridegroom,
and said to him,

block.text: Orait ol wokman i kisim sampela na karim i go.

Dispela wara i kamap pinis olsem wain na man i bosim kaikai i traim, tasol em i no save, ol i kisim dispela wain we. Ol wokman i bin pulimapim wara, ol tasol i save. Orait man i bosim kaikai em i singautim dispela man i marit,
na em i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when the guests have drunk freely, then that which is worse. You have kept the good wine until now!”

block.text: "Olgeta man i save tilim gutpela wain pastaim. Na taim ol man i dring planti pinis, orait ol i save tilim wain i nogut liklik. Tasol yu, yu bin pasim gutpela wain, na nau tasol yu kisim i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: This beginning of his signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.

block.text: Dispela em i namba wan mirakel Jisas i wokim. Em i wokim long taun Kana long distrik Galili. Dispela mirakel em i olsem mak bilong soim bikpela namba na strong bilong en. Na ol disaipel bilong en ol i lukim na ol i bilip long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this, he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, his brothers, and his disciples; and they stayed there a few days.

block.text: Orait Jisas i lusim Kana na em i go daun long taun Kaperneam wantaim mama bilong en na ol brata bilong en na ol disaipel bilong en. Na ol i stap sampela de long dispela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Wanpela bikpela de bilong lotu bilong ol Juda klostu i laik kamap, em Bikpela De Bilong Tingim De God I Larim Ol Israel I Stap Gut. Olsem na Jisas i go long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He found in the temple those who sold oxen, sheep, and doves, and the changers of money sitting.

block.text: Insait long banis bilong tempel em i lukim ol man i wok bisnis long salim ol bulmakau na sipsip na pisin. Na em i lukim ol man bilong senisim mani ol i sindaun i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He made a whip of cords, and threw all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables.
To those who sold the doves, he said,

block.text: Orait Jisas i kisim baklain na i wokim wanpela wip. Na em i rausim dispela olgeta man wantaim ol sipsip na ol bulmakau bilong ol, na ol i lusim hap bilong tempel na i go. Na em i kapsaitim mani bilong ol man i senisim mani, na em i kapsaitim tu ol tebol bilong ol.
Na em i tok olsem long ol man i wok bisnis long salim ol pisin,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take these things out of here! Don't make my Father's house a marketplace!”

block.text: "Kisim ol pisin bilong yupela I go. Yupela i no ken mekim haus bilong Papa bilong mi i kamap olsem haus bilong maket."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples remembered that it was written,

block.text: Ol disaipel bilong en i lukim dispela pasin em i mekim na ol i tingim wanpela tok i stap long buk bilong God. Dispela tok i olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Zeal for your house will eat me up.”

block.text: "Mi laikim tru haus bilong yu, olsem na mi wok strong long mekim dispela haus i stap gut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore answered him,

block.text: Tasol ol Juda i lukim dispela pasin Jisas i mekim na ol i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What sign do you show us, seeing that you do these things?”

block.text: "Bai yu wokim wanem mirakel, olsem mak bilong soim mipela olsem yu gat namba bilong mekimdispela pasin nau yu bin mekim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”

block.text: "Yupela brukim dispela tempel, na long tripela de bai mi kirapim gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore said,

block.text: Na ol Juda i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It took forty-six years to build this temple! Will you raise it up in three days?”

block.text: "Olaman. Inap long 46 yia ol I bin mekim wok bilong sanapim dispela tempel, na long tripela de tasol bai yu kirapim gen, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he spoke of the temple of his body.

block.text: Tasol dispela tempel Jisas i tok long en, em bodi bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

block.text: Olsem na taim God i kirapim em longmatmat, ol disaipel bilong en i tingim gen dispela tok bipo em i binmekim. Na ol i bilipim tok i stap long buk bilong God wantaim dispela tok Jisas i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name, observing his signs which he did.

block.text: Jisas i stap long Jerusalem long Bikpela De Bilong Tingim De God I Larim Ol Israel I Stap Gut, na planti manmeri i lukim ol mirakel o mak em i wokim. Olsem na ol i bilip long nem bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus didn't trust himself to them, because he knew everyone,
and because he didn't need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

block.text: Tasol Jisas i no bilip long ol,
long wanem, em i save pinis long pasin bilong olgeta man. Em i no sot long save na wanpela man i mas toksave long em long pasin bilong ol man. Nogat. Em yet i save pinis long tingting bilong ol man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 3
Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.

block.text: Wanpela man i stap, nem bilong en Nikodemus. Em i wanpela Farisi, na em i wanpela hetman bilong ol Juda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same came to him by night, and said to him,

block.text: Dispela man i kam long Jisas long nait na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him.”

block.text: "Tisa, mipela i save, God i bin salim yu i kam olsem tisa. Sapos God i no i stap wantaim wanpela man, orait dispela man i no inap wokim ol dispela mirakel yu save wokim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, unless one is born anew, he can't see the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yu, sapos man i no kamap nupela gen, em i no inap lukim kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus said to him,

block.text: Na Nikodemus i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother's womb, and be born?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na man i lapun pinis em inap long kamap nupela gen? Ating em inap i go insait gen long bel bilong mama bilong en na mama i karim em gen?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, unless one is born of water and spirit, he can't enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yu, sapos man i no kamap nupela long wara na long Holi Spirit, em i no inap i go insait long kingdom bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

block.text: Samting bodi i kamapim, em i bodi. Na samting Holi Spirit i kamapim, em i spirit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’

block.text: Yu no ken kirap nogut long dispela tok mi tokim yu, 'Yupela i mas kamap nupela gen.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don't know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”

block.text: Win em i save bihainim laik bilong em yet na i go long narapela narapela hap. Yu save harim nois bilong en, tasol yu no save em i kam we na em i go we. Na olgeta man i kamap nupela long Holi Spirit, ol i olsem tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus answered him,

block.text: Nikodemus i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can these things be?”

block.text: "Dispela samting yu tok long en, em inap i kamap olsem wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the teacher of Israel, and don't understand these things?

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Yu tisa bilong Israel na yu no klia long dispela samting?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, we speak that which we know, and testify of that which we have seen, and you don't receive our witness.

block.text: Tru tumas mi tokim yu, mipela i toktok long samting mipela i save long en. Na mipela i autim tok long samting mipela i lukim pinis. Tasolyupela i save givim baksait long dispela tok mipela i autim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I told you earthly things and you don't believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?

block.text: Mi bin tokim yupela long ol samting bilong graun, na yupela i no bilipim. Olsem na sapos mi tokim yupela long ol samting bilong heven, bai yupela i bilipim olsem wanem?

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one has ascended into heaven, but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.

block.text: I no gat narapela man i bin i go antap long heven. Nogat. Pikinini Bilong Man em wanpela tasol i bin lusim heven na i kam daun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

block.text: Bipo Moses i bin litimapim snek long ples nating, na long wankain pasin ol bai i litimapim Pikinini Bilong Man.
Olsem bai olgeta man i bilip long em, ol i ken kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

block.text: "God i gat wanpela Pikinini tasol i stap. Tasol God i laikim tumas olgeta manmeri bilong graun, olsem na em i givim dispela wanpela Pikinini long ol. Em i mekim olsem bilong olgeta manmeri i bilip long em ol i no ken lus. Nogat. Bai ol i kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God didn't send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.

block.text: God i no salim Pikinini bilong en i kam long graun bilong skelim pasin bilong ol manmeri bilong graun olsem jas. Nogat. Em i salim em i kam bilong kisim bek ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn't believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

block.text: Man i bilip long em, em i no gat kot. Man i no bilip, em i lus pinis long kot, long wanem, em i no bin bilip long nem bilong dispela wanpela Pikinini Bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.

block.text: Na as bilong kot bilong ol em i olsem. Lait i kamap pinis long graun, tasol ol man i laikim tumas tudak. Ol i no laikim lait, long wanem, ol i man bilong mekim pasin nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who does evil hates the light, and doesn't come to the light, lest his works would be exposed.

block.text: Olgeta man i save mekim pasin nogut, ol i birua bilong lait. Ol i no laik bai pasin bilong ol i kamap ples klia. Olsem na ol i no save kam long lait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his works may be revealed, that they have been done in God.”

block.text: Tasol man i mekim pasin i tru, em i save kam long lait, bai ol man i ken lukim gut olsem, em i bin mekim wok bilong en long strong bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them, and baptized.

block.text: Orait bihain Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i go long hap bilong Judia. Em i stap wantaim ol long dispela hap na i givim baptais long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John also was baptizing in Enon near Salim, because there was much water there. They came, and were baptized.

block.text: Jon tu i givim baptais long ol manmeri long ples Ainon klostu long ples Salim. Planti wara i stap long dispela ples, na ol manmeri i kam long em bilong kisim baptais.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John was not yet thrown into prison.

block.text: Long dispela taim Herot i no bin putim Jon long kalabus yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John's disciples with some Jews about purification.

block.text: Wanpela tok pait i kirap namel long ol disaipel bilong Jon na wanpela Juda. Ol i toktok long wanem pasin bilong waswas ol i mas bihainim long kamap klin long ai bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to John, and said to him,

block.text: Na ol disaipel i go long Jon, na ol i tokim em olsem,

block.characterId: disciples of John the Baptist/a Jew

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciples of John the Baptist/a Jew
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, the same baptizes, and everyone is coming to him.”

block.text: "Tisa, dispela man bipo em i stap wantaim yu long hapsait bilong wara Jordan na yu bin autim tok bilong em, dispela man nau em i givim baptais long ol manmeri, na olgeta ol i go long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered,

block.text: Orait Jon i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man can receive nothing, unless it has been given him from heaven.

block.text: "Sapos God long heven i no givim samting long wanpela man, orait dispela man i no inap kisim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’

block.text: Yupela yet i harim pinis dispela tok mi mekim bipo, 'Mi no dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en, tasol God i salim mi na mi kam paslain long em.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom's voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i maritim meri, orait dispela meri em i bilong dispela man i maritim em. Na poroman bilong dispela man em i save sanap na putim yau na amamas tru long harim tok bilong dispela man i marit. Olsem tasol nau amamas i pulap long bel bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.

block.text: Nem bilong em i mas kamap bikpela, na nem bilong mi i mas i go daun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.

block.text: Man i bin i stap antap na i kam, em i antap long olgeta samting. Man bilong dispela graun, em i save mekim ol pasin bilong dispela graun, na em i save mekim toktok long ol samting bilong dispela graun. Tasol man i kam long heven, em i antap long olgeta samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness.

block.text: Em i save autim tok long ol samting em i lukim pinis na i harim pinis. Tasol i no gat wanpela man i kisim na i holimpas dispela tok em i autim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has received his witness has set his seal to this, that God is true.

block.text: Man i kisim na i holimpas tok bilong em, em i soim olsem em i bilip tru long dispela tok, "God em i save tok tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.

block.text: Dispela man God i salim i kam, em i save autim tok bilong God, long wanem, God i no givim Holi Spirit hap hap tasol long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into his hand.

block.text: Papa em i laikim tru Pikinini, na i putim olgeta samting long han bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One who believes in the Son has eternal life, but one who disobeys the Son won't see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”

block.text: Man i bilip long Pikinini, em i gat laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim. Tasol man i no bihainim tok bilong Pikinini, em bai i no inap kisim laip. Nogat. Belhat bilong God i stap long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 4
Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
(although Jesus himself didn't baptize, but his disciples),
he left Judea, and departed into Galilee.

block.text: Ol Farisi i harim tok olsem, Jisas i baptaisim planti man na ol dispela man i kamap disaipel bilong en, na namba bilong ol i winim namba bilong ol disaipel bilong Jon. Tasol Jisas yet i no save givim baptais long ol man. Nogat. Ol disaipel bilong Jisas tasol i save baptaisim ol. Jisas i save olsem, ol Farisi i harim tok pinis long planti man i kamap disaipel bilong en, olsem na em i lusim distrik Judia na em i go bek long distrik Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He needed to pass through Samaria.

block.text: Na dispela rot em i bihainim, em i go namel long distrik Samaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he came to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph.

block.text: Olsem na em i go kamap long wanpela taun bilong Samaria, ol i kolim Sikar. Sikar i stap klostu long dispela graun Jekop i bin givim long pikinini bilong en, Josep.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.

block.text: Wanpela hul wara, bipo Jekop i bin wokim, em i stap long dispela ples. Jisas i wokabaut i kam na em i tait. Olsem na em i sindaun klostu long dispela hul wara. Em i olsem 12 klok belo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her,

block.text: Wanpela meri bilong Samaria em i kam bilong pulimapim wara, na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me a drink.”

block.text: "Wara i kam. Mi laik dring."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.

block.text: Ol disaipel bilong en ol i go pinis long taun bilong baim kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Samaritan woman therefore said to him,

block.text: Dispela meri bilong Samaria em i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?”

block.text: "Yu Juda, na mi meri bilong Samaria. Olsem wanem na yu tok, 'Wara i kam, mi laik dring'?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
Jesus answered her,

block.text: Meri i mekim dispela tok, long wanem, ol Juda i no save poromanim ol Samaria.
Orait Jisas i tokim dispela meri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”

block.text: "Sapos yu save long presen bilong God, na sapos yu save long dispela man i tokim yu, 'Wara i kam, mi laik dring,' orait bai yu tokim em, na em bai i givim yu wara i gat laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Na meri i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. From where then have you that living water?

block.text: "Bikman, yu no gat baket, na dispela hul wara em i daun moa. Olsem na dispela wara i gat laip, bai yu kisim we?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Are you greater than our father, Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, as did his children, and his livestock?”

block.text: Tumbuna bilong yumi Jekop em i givim dispela hul wara long mipela. Na em yet wantaim ol pikinini bilong en na ol bulmakau sipsip samting bilong en, olgeta i bin dring long dispela hul wara. Ating yu winim Jekop, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered her,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,

block.text: "Olgeta man i dring long dispela wara hia, nek bilong ol bai i drai gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst again; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”

block.text: Tasol sapos wanpela man i dring long dispela wara mi laik givim em, i no gat wanpela taim nek bilong en bai i drai gen. Nogat. Dispela wara mi laik givim em, em bai i kamap olsem hul wara insait long em. Na dispela wara bai i kamap kamap oltaim na givim em laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Na meri i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, give me this water, so that I don't get thirsty, neither come all the way here to draw.”

block.text: "Bikman, givim dispela wara long mi. Na bihain nek bilong mi i no ken drai moa, na mi no ken i kam hia bilong pulimapim wara."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go, call your husband, and come here.”

block.text: "Yu go singautim man bilong yu pastaim na yu kam bek long hia."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman answered,

block.text: Meri i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have no husband.”

block.text: "Mi no gat man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You said well, ‘I have no husband,’
for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.”

block.text: "Yu tok yu no gat man, em yu tok tru tumas,
long wanem, bipo yu gat 5 -pela man. Na dispela man nau yu stap wantaim em, em i no man bilong yu. Dispela tok bilong yu em i tru olgeta."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Na meri i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.

block.text: "Bikman, nau mi save, yu wanpela profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, but you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.”

block.text: Ol tumbuna bilong mipela ol i save bung long dispela maunten na mekim lotu. Tasol yupela Juda i save tok, ples ol man i mas i go long en na mekim lotu, em i stap long Jerusalem tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Orait Jisas I tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, believe me, the hour comes, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, will you worship the Father.

block.text: "Meri, yu mas bilipim tok bilong mi. Wanpela taim i laik kamap na bai yupela i no lotu long Papa long dispela maunten, na bai yupela i no lotu long em long Jerusalem tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You worship that which you don't know. We worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.

block.text: Yupela Samaria i save lotu long samting yupela i no save long en. Tasol mipela Juda i save lotu long samting mipela i save long en, long wanem, God i bin makim mipela Juda long i go pas long dispela wok bilong kisim bek ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshippers.

block.text: Tasol taim i laik kamap, na nau i kamap pinis, na olgeta man i laik lotu tru bai ol i lotu long Papa long strong bilong Holi Spirit na long pasin i tru. Na Papa i laikim tumas bai ol kain man olsem i mas lotu long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God is a Spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”

block.text: God em i Spirit. Na ol man i lotu long em, ol i mas lotu long strong bilong Holi Spirit na long pasin i tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Meri i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I know that Messiah comes,” (he who is called Christ). “When he has come, he will declare to us all things.”

block.text: "Mi save, Mesaia bai i kam, em dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en. Taim em i kam, em bai i tokim yumi long olgeta samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am he, the one who speaks to you.”

block.text: "Em mi tasol, nau mi toktok wantaim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: At this, his disciples came. They marveled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no one said, “What are you looking for?” or, “Why do you speak with her?”

block.text: Jisas i tok olsem, na long dispela taim ol disaipel bilong en i kam bek. Ol i lukim em i toktok wantaim wanpela meri, na ol i tingting planti. Tasol i no gat wanpela man i askim Jisas olsem, "Yu laik kisim wanem samting?" o "Bilong wanem yu toktok wantaim dispela meri?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the woman left her water pot, and went away into the city, and said to the people,

block.text: Orait dispela meri i lusim baket bilong en, na em i go bek long taun. Na em i tokim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything that I did. Can this be the Christ?”

block.text: "Yupela kam lukim wanpela man. Em i tokim mi long olgeta samting mi bin mekim bipo. Ating em dispela man tasol God i bin promis long salim em i kam?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.

block.text: Orait ol i lusim taun na ol i kam long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying,

block.text: Long dispela taim, ol disaipel i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, eat.”

block.text: "Tisa, yu mas kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Tasol em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have food to eat that you don't know about.”

block.text: "Mi gat kaikai yupela i no save long en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples therefore said one to another,

block.text: Olsem na ol disaipel i toktok long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”

block.text: "Ating wanpela man I bringim kaikai i kam givim em?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.

block.text: "God i bin salim mi na mi kam, na kaikai bilong mi, em long bihainim laik bilong em na long pinisim wok em i bin givim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't you say, ‘There are yet four months until the harvest?’ Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.

block.text: "Yupela i save tok olsem, 'I gat 4 -pela mun i stap yet na taim bilong kisim kaikai bai i kamap.' Tasol mi tokim yupela, yupela i mas lukluk nabaut na lukim gut ol gaden. Ol kaikai i redi pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit to eternal life; that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.

block.text: Man i wok long kisim kaikai, em i kisim pe bilong en na em i bungim kaikai bilong laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim. Olsem na man bilong planim kaikai na man bilong kisim kaikai, tupela i ken amamas wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in this the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’

block.text: Olsem na dispela tok em i tru, 'Wanpela man i planim gaden na narapela man i kisim kaikai bilong en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: I sent you to reap that for which you haven't labored. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.”

block.text: Mi bin salim yupela i go bilong kisim kaikai long gaden bipo yupela i no bin wok long en. Ol arapela man i bin wokim gaden, na yupela i go insait bilong kisim kaikai i kamap long hatwok bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that city many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the word of the woman, who testified, “He told me everything that I did.”

block.text: Planti Samaria bilong dispela taun ol i harim tok bilong dispela meri, na ol i bilip long Jisas. Long wanem, meri i tok, "Em i tokim mi pinis long olgeta samting mi bin mekim bipo."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. He stayed there two days.

block.text: Na ol Samaria i kam long em, na ol i askim em long stap wantaim ol. Olsem na em i stap tupela de long dispela ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many more believed because of his word.

block.text: Na planti manmeri moa ol i harim tok bilong Jisas yet na ol i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to the woman,

block.text: Na ol i tokim dispela meri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now we believe, not because of your speaking; for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”

block.text: "Mipela i no harim tok bilong yu tasol na mipela I bilip long dispela man. Nogat. Mipela yet i harim tok bilong en, na mipela i save, dispela man tasol em i man bilong kisim bek olgeta manmeri bilong graun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee.

block.text: Jisas i stap tupela de pinis wantaim ol lain bilong Samaria, orait em i lusim dispela ples na i go long distrik Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

block.text: Jisas yet i autim tok olsem, "Profet i no gat nem long as ples bilong em yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast, for they also went to the feast.

block.text: Em i go kamap long Galili, na ol Galili i amamas long em i kam, long wanem, ol tu i bin i go long dispela bikpela lotu long Jerusalem na ol i lukim olgeta samting em i bin mekim long dispela taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water into wine. There was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.

block.text: Jisas i kamap gen long taun Kana bilong Galili. Long dispela taun em i bin tanim wara i kamap wain. Orait long dispela taim wanpela ofisa bilong king i stap long taun Kaperneam, na pikinini man bilong en i gat sik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard that Jesus had left Judea and had come to Galilee, he went to him, and begged him, saying:

block.text: Dispela man i harim tok olsem, Jisas i lusim Judia na i kamap pinis long Galili. Olsem na em i go long Jisas na i askim em long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and heal my son because he is at the point of death.”

block.text: kam daun long Kaperneam na mekim orait dispela pikinini bilong en. Pikinini em i klostu i laik i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will in no way believe.”

block.text: "Sapos yupela i no lukim ol kain kain mirakel, yupela i no laik bilip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The nobleman said to him,

block.text: Ofisa bilong king i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu kam daun kwik. Nogut pikinini bilong mi i dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas I tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Your son lives.”

block.text: "Yu go. Pikinini bilong yu bai i stap laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.

block.text: Orait dispela ofisa i bilipim tok bilong Jisas, na em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was now going down, his servants met him and reported, saying

block.text: Dispela ofisa i no kamap yet long Kaperneam, na ol wokboi bilong en i kam bungim em long rot, na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your child lives!”

block.text: "Pikinini bilong yu em i stap laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he asked them:

block.text: Na em i askim ol long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What time did he get better?”

block.text: wanem aua pikinini i orait liklik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him:

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The fever left him yesterday, at the seventh hour.”

block.text: "Asde long 1 klok long apinun sik i lusim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” He believed, as did his whole house.

block.text: Na papa i save, asde long dispela aua tasol Jisas i bin tokim em, "Pikinini bilong yu bai i stap laip." Na em i bilip, na olgeta lain bilong en tu i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judea into Galilee.

block.text: Dispela em i namba 2 mirakel o mak Jisas i wokim bihain long em i lusim Judia na i kam i stap long Galili. ol bikpela de bilong lotu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 5
After these things, there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Bihain wanpela bikpela de bilong lotu bilong ol Juda i kamap, na Jisas i go long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in Jerusalem by the sheep gate, there is a pool, which is called in Hebrew, “Bethesda,” having five porches.

block.text: Long Jerusalem, klostu long bikpela dua bilong banis ol i kolim Dua Bilong Ol Sipsip, i gat wanpela bikpela hul wara i stap, long tok Hibru ol i kolim Betesda. Arere long dispela hul wara i gat 5 -pela veranda i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water;

block.text: In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water;

ReferenceBlocks.text: for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had.

block.text: for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain man was there, who had been sick for thirty-eight years.

block.text: Wanpela man i stap long veranda, em i gat sik i stap inap long 38 yia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him,

block.text: Jisas i lukim dispela man i slip i stap, na em i save, em i stap sik longtaim pinis. Na Jisas i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you want to be made well?”

block.text: "Ating yu laik bai skin bilong yu i kamap gutpela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sick man answered him,

block.text: Sikman I bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I'm coming, another steps down before me.”

block.text: "Bikman, taim wara i mekim nais, mi no gat man i ken kisim mi i go na putim mi insait long hul wara. Mi yet mi laik i go, tasol ol arapela man i save go daun pastaim na i winim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, take up your mat, and walk.”

block.text: "Yu sanap na kisim bet bilong yu na wokabaut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, the man was made well, and took up his mat and walked. Now it was the Sabbath on that day.

block.text: Orait kwiktaim tumas bodi bilong dispela man em I kamap gutpela. Na em i kisim bet bilong en na i wokabaut i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the Jews said to him who was cured,

block.text: olsem na taim ol Juda i lukim dispela man ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry the mat.”

block.text: "Nau em i de Sabat. I tambu long yu karim bet bilong yu raun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Tasol em i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who made me well, the same said to me, ‘Take up your mat, and walk.’”

block.text: "Dispela man i mekim mi i orait, em I tokim mi olsem, 'Kisim bet bilong yu na wokabaut.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they asked him,

block.text: Na ol I askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take up your mat, and walk’?”

block.text: "Wanem man i tokim yu, 'Kisim bet bilong yu na wokabaut'?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who was healed didn't know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in the place.

block.text: Tasol dispela man i kamap orait gen em i no save husat tru i bin tokim em, long wanem, planti manmeri i stap long dispela ples, na Jisas i go pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him,

block.text: Bihain Jisas i go insait long banis bilong tempel na em i lukim dispela man i stap. Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, you are made well. Sin no more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”

block.text: "Harim. Nau yu orait pinis. Yu no ken mekim sin moa, nogut wanpela bikpela hevi moa yet i kamap long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.

block.text: Orait dispela man i go na i tokim ol Juda olsem, "Dispela man i mekim mi i orait, em Jisas tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath.
But Jesus answered them,

block.text: Orait ol Juda i stat long mekim nogut long Jisas, long wanem, em i save mekim dispela kain samting long ol de Sabat.
Tasol Jisas i bekim tok olsem long ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Father is still working so I, too, am working.”

block.text: "Papa bilong mi em I save wok oltaim i kam inap long nau. Na mi tu mi save wok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

block.text: Ol Juda i harim dispela tok na ol i laikim moa yet long kilim Jisas i dai, long wanem, em i no kalapim lo bilong de Sabat tasol. Nogat. Em i tok, God em i Papa bilong em stret. Long dispela tok em i mekim em yet i kamap wankain olsem God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore answered them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol Juda olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise.

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, Pikinini em i no inap mekim wanpela samting long tingting bilong em yet. Nogat. Em i mekim tasol ol samting em i lukim Papa i mekim. Olgeta samting Papa i save mekim, em Pikinini tu i save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel.

block.text: Papa i laikim tumas Pikinini na em i save soim em olgeta samting em yet i save mekim. Na bilong mekim yupela i kirap nogut tru, Papa bai i soim Pikinini ol arapela bikpela wok tu, i winim ol dispela wok em i mekim pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom he desires.

block.text: Papa i save kirapim bek ol man i dai pinis na i givim laip long ol. Na olsem tasol Pikinini tu i save givim laip long ol man long laik bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son,
that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn't honor the Son doesn't honor the Father who sent him.”

block.text: Papa i no save skelim wanpela man long kot. Olgeta wok bilong harim kot, em i givim pinis long Pikinini.

Olsem na bai olgeta man i ken litimapim nem bilong Pikinini, olsem ol i save litimapim nem bilong Papa. Man i no save litimapim nem bilong Pikinini, em i no litimapim nem bilong Papa i bin salim Pikinini i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn't come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, man i harim tok bilong mi, na i bilip long Papa, em i bin salim mi na mi kam, em i gat laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim. Em bai i no gat kot. Nogat. Em i lusim dai pinis, na nau em i stap laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, the hour comes, and now is, when the dead will hear the Son of God's voice; and those who hear will live.

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, taim i laik kamap, na nau i kamap pinis, na ol manmeri i dai pinis bai i harim maus bilong Pikinini Bilong God. Na ol manmeri i harim, ol bai i kisim laip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as the Father has life in himself, even so he gave to the Son also to have life in himself.

block.text: Papa i gat laip long em yet. Na em i bin givim strong long Pikinini, na em tu i gat laip long em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.

block.text: Em i Pikinini Bilong Man, olsem na Papa i givim namba long em bilong kotim ol manmeri na skelim pasin bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,
and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of damnation.

block.text: Yupela i no ken tingting planti long dispela tok bilong mi. Taim i laik kamap na olgeta manmeri i stap long matmat ol bai i harim maus bilong Pikinini,

na ol bai i lusim matmat na i kam ausait. Ol manmeri i bin mekim gutpela pasin, ol bai i kirap bek na i stap laip. Na ol manmeri i bin mekim pasin nogut, ol bai i kirap bek na i kamap long kot na kot bai i tok olsem, ol i mas bagarap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: I can of myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous; because I don't seek my own will, but the will of my Father who sent me.”

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Mi no inap mekim wanpela samting long tingting bilong mi yet. Mi save bihainim tok mi kisim long Papa na mi skelim pasin bilong ol manmeri. Na kot bilong mi em i stret, long wanem, mi no save bihainim laik bilong mi yet. Nogat. Mi bihainim laik bilong Papa, em i bin salim mi na mi kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I testify about myself, my witness is not valid.

block.text: "Sapos mi wanpela tasol mi tokaut long ol wok na pasin bilong mi, orait ol man i no mas bilipim dispela tok mi autim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is another who testifies about me. I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true.

block.text: Tasol narapela em i stap, na em tu i save tokaut long ol wok na pasin bilong mi. Na mi save, dispela tok em i autim, em i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.

block.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the testimony which I receive is not from man. However, I say these things that you may be saved.

block.text: But the testimony which I receive is not from man. However, I say these things that you may be saved.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.

block.text: Jon em i bin i stap olsem lam i lait na i givim lait long ol man. Na long sotpela taim bel bilong yupela i bin amamas long lait bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the testimony which I have is greater than that of John, for the works which the Father gave me to accomplish, the very works that I do, testify about me, that the Father has sent me.

block.text: "Tasol samting i winim Jon, em i tokaut long mi nau. Em dispela olgeta wok Papa i bin givim long mi bilong mekim na pinisim. Ol dispela wok mi save mekim i tokaut gut long ol manmeri olsem, Papa i bin salim mi na mi kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Father himself, who sent me, has testified about me. You have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.

block.text: Na Papa i bin salim mi na mi kam, em yet i tokaut long mi. Tasol yupela i no bin harim maus bilong em liklik. Nogat tru. Na yupela i no bin lukim pes bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You don't have his word living in you; because you don't believe him whom he sent.”

block.text: Na tok bilong em tu i no i stap long yupela, long wanem, yupela i no bilipim tok bilong dispela man Papa i bin salim i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You search the Scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life; and these are they which testify about me.

block.text: "Yupela i ting tok i stap long buk bilong God i save givim yupela laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim. Olsem na yupela i save wok long ritim na skelim olgeta tok i stap long buk bilong God. Tasol buk bilong God tu i save tokaut long mi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet you will not come to me, that you may have life.
I don't receive glory from men.

block.text: na yupela i no laik i kam long mi bilong kisim laip.
"Mi no ting long kisim biknem long ol man na mi mekim ol dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I know you, that you don't have God's love in yourselves.

block.text: Tasol mi save long yupela. Long bel bilong yupela, yupela i no gat laik long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have come in my Father's name, and you don't receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

block.text: Mi bin i kam long nem bilong Papa bilong mi, na yupela i no kisim tok bilong mi. Tasol sapos wanpela man i kam long nem bilong em yet, orait wantu bai yupela i kisim tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How can you believe, who receive glory from one another, and you don't seek the glory that comes from the only God?”

block.text: Yupela i save kisim biknem long ol lain bilong yupela yet. Tasol dispela biknem God wanpela tasol i save givim, em yupela i no laik kisim. Sapos yupela i mekim ol dispela kain pasin, orait bai yupela i bilip olsem wanem?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, even Moses, on whom you have set your hope.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken ting bai mi kotim yupela long ai bilong Papa. Nogat. Man i kotim yupela em Moses yet, em dispela man yupela i ting em bai i helpim yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe me; for he wrote about me.

block.text: Sapos yupela i bilipim tok bilong Moses, orait bai yupela i bilipim tok bilong mi tu, long wanem, ol tok em i bin raitim i tokaut long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you don't believe his writings, how will you believe my words?”

block.text: Tasol sapos yupela i no bilipim tok em i bin raitim, orait olsem wanem bai yupela i bilipim tok bilong mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 6
After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

block.text: Bihain Jisas i go long hapsait bilong raunwara Galili, narapela nem bilong en raunwara Taiberias.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick.

block.text: Na bikpela lain manmeri ol i lukim ol planti mirakel em i bin wokim bilong mekim orait ol sikman, olsem na ol i bihainim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went up into the mountain, and he sat there with his disciples.

block.text: Na Jisas i go antap long maunten na i sindaun wantaim ol disaipel bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was at hand.

block.text: Long dispela taim bikpela de bilong ol Juda klostu i laik kamap, em Bikpela De Bilong Tingim De God I Larim Ol Israel I Stap Gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes, and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip,

block.text: Jisas i lukluk nabaut na i lukim bikpela lain manmeri i kam long em. Na em i askim Filip olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where are we to buy bread, that these may eat?”

block.text: "Bai yumi baim bret we bilong ol dispela manmeri i ken kaikai?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: This he said to test him, for he himself knew what he would do.

block.text: Em i mekim dispela tok bilong traim Filip tasol. Em yet i save pinis long samting em i laik mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip answered him,

block.text: Filip i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that everyone of them may receive a little.”

block.text: "Sapos yumi baim bret inap long 200 kina, em bai i no inap long olgeta wan wan man na meri i ken kisim hap liklik kaikai tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to him,

block.text: Orait wanpela disaipel bilong Jisas, em Andru, brata bilong Saimon Pita, em i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these among so many?”

block.text: "Wanpela manki i stap hia, em i gat 5 -pela bret ol i wokim long bali na tupela pis. Tasol bikpela lain manmeri tru i stap. Dispela bret na pis bai i helpim yumi olsem wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have the people sit down.”

block.text: "Tokim ol manmeri long sindaun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was much grass in that place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

block.text: Planti gras i stap long dispela hap. Na ol man i sindaun, namba bilong ol em i olsem 5,00 .

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus took the loaves; and having given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; likewise also of the fish as much as they desired.

block.text: Ol i sindaun pinis, na Jisas i kisim dispela bret na i tenkyu long God na i tilim i go long ol manmeri. Em i mekim olsem long tupela pis tu. Em i givim long ol, na ol i kisim inap long laik bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were filled, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Ol i kaikai inap pinis, na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.”

block.text: "Yupela bungim olgeta hap kaikai i stap yet. Nogut sampela I lus nating."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which were left over by those who had eaten.

block.text: Olsem na ol i bungim ol liklik hap bilong dispela 5 -pela bret, na ol i pulapim 12 -pela basket. Ol man ol i kaikai inap pinis na dispela i stap yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore the people saw the sign which Jesus did, they said,

block.text: Ol manmeri i lukim dispela mirakel o mak em i bin wokim, na ol i tok,

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is truly the prophet who comes into the world.”

block.text: "Tru tumas, em i dispela profet God i bin tok long salim i kam long graun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore, perceiving that they were about to come and take him by force, to make him king, withdrew again to the mountain by himself.

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela tok na em i save, ol i laik i kam holimpas em na mekim em i kamap king bilong ol. Olsem na em i lusim dispela ples na em wanpela tasol i go bek gen long maunten.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
and they entered into the boat, and were going over the sea to Capernaum.
It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.

block.text: Long apinun ol disaipel bilong Jisas i go daun long raunwara.
Ol i kalap long wanpela bot na ol i brukim raunwara i go. Ol i laik i go long Kaperneam.
Em i tudak pinis, na Jisas i no kamap yet long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sea was tossed by a great wind blowing.

block.text: Strongpela win i kamap, na win i mekim bikpela si i kirap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing near to the boat; and they were afraid.
But he said to them,

block.text: Ol i pul long bot i go inap 5 -pela o 6 -pela kilomita, na ol i lukim Jisas i wokabaut antap long raunwara na i kamap klostu long bot. Ol i pret,
tasol Jisas i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is I. Don't be afraid.”

block.text: "Em mi yet mi i kam. Yupela I no ken pret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat. Immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.

block.text: Orait ol i amamas long kisim em i kam insait long bot, na wantu bot i kamap long dispela ples ol i go long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one in which his disciples had embarked, and that Jesus hadn't entered with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples had gone away alone.

block.text: Long de bihain, ol manmeri i stap yet long hapsait bilong raunwara. Ol i save, asde i no gat narapela bot. Wanpela bot tasol i stap, na Jisas i no bin kalap long dispela bot wantaim ol disaipel bilong en. Nogat. Ol disaipel tasol ol i bin kalap long dispela bot na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However boats from Tiberias came near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

block.text: Tasol sampela bot bilong Taiberias i kam klostu long dispela ples Bikpela i bin givim tenkyu long bret na ol i kaikai,

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the multitude therefore saw that Jesus wasn't there, nor his disciples, they themselves got into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

block.text: na ol manmeri i lukim olsem, Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i no i stap. Olsem na ol i kalap long ol dispela bot, na ol i go long Kaperneam bilong painim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him,

block.text: Ol manmeri i go kamap pinis long Jisas long hapsait bilong raunwara, na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, when did you come here?”

block.text: "Tisa, yu kam hia long wanem taim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, you seek me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves, and were filled.

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, yupela i no tingting long ol mirakel yupela i lukim, em ol mak mi bin soim yupela, na yupela i kam painim mi. Nogat. Yupela i kaikai dispela bret mi bin givim yupela na bel bilong yupela i pulap, na long dispela as tasol yupela i wok long painim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't work for the food which perishes, but for the food which remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has sealed him.”

block.text: Yupela i no ken wok long kisim kain kaikai i save bagarap. Nogat. Yupela i mas wok long kisim kaikai i save stap oltaim, em kaikai bilong laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim. Dispela kain kaikai, Pikinini Bilong Man bai i givim long yupela. God Papa i givim namba pinis long em long mekim olsem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Orait na ol i tokim em olsem,

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What must we do, that we may work the works of God?”

block.text: "Mipela i mas mekim wanem na mipela i ken mekim wok bilong God?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent.”

block.text: "Wok bilong God i olsem. Yupela i mas bilip long dispela man, God i bin salim em i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Ol i harim dispela tok na ol I askim em olsem,

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do?

block.text: "Bai yu wokim wanem mirakel olsem mak bilong mipela I ken lukim na mipela i ken bilipim tok bilong yu?

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’”

block.text: Ol tumbuna bilong mipela i bin kaikai mana long ples nating, olsem tok i stap long buk bilong God, 'Em i givim bret bilong heven long ol manmeri na ol I kaikai.' Tasol bai yu wokim wanem kain mirakel tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, it wasn't Moses who gave you the bread out of heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven.

block.text: "Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, i no Moses i bin givim bret bilong heven long yupela. Nogat. Papa bilong mi em i save givim bret tru bilong heven long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven, and gives life to the world.”

block.text: Dispela bret God i givim, em i lusim heven na i kam daun na i givim laip long ol manmeri bilong graun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Na ol i tokim em olsem,

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, always give us this bread.”

block.text: "Bikman, yu mas givim dispela bret long mipela oltaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.

block.text: "Mi yet mi bret bilong laip. Man i kam long mi, em bai i no hangre moa. Na man I bilip long mi, em bai i no i dai moa long dring wara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I told you that you have seen me, and yet you don't believe.

block.text: "Mi bin tokim yupela, yupela i lukim mi pinis, tasol yupela i no bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All those whom the Father gives me will come to me. He who comes to me I will in no way throw out.

block.text: Olgeta manmeri Papa i givim long mi, ol bai i kam long mi. Na man i kam long mi, mi no inap tru long rausim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.

block.text: Mi no lusim heven na kam daun bilong bihainim laik bilong mi yet. Nogat. Mi kam daun bilong bihainim laik bilong Papa, em i bin salim mi na mi kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the will of my Father who sent me, that of all he has given to me I should lose nothing, but should raise him up at the last day.

block.text: Na laik bilong Papa, em i bin salim mi na mi kam, em i olsem. Mi no ken lusim wanpela bilong ol manmeri em i givim mi pinis. Nogat. Mi mas kirapim ol long las de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the will of the one who sent me, that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.”

block.text: Laik bilong Papa bilong mi em i olsem. Olgeta man i lukim Pikinini na i bilip long em, ol bai i kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim. Na bai mi kirapim ol long las de."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said,

block.text: Ol Juda I harim Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the bread which came down out of heaven.”

block.text: "Mi yet, mi dispela bret i bin lusim heven na i kam daun,"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: na ol i kros na i toktok planti long em.
Ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then does he say, ‘I have come down out of heaven?’”

block.text: "Dispela man em Jisas, pikinini bilong Josep. Yumi save long papa wantaim mama bilong en. Orait olsem wanem na nau em i tok, 'Mi bin lusim heven na mi kam daun'?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't murmur among yourselves.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken toktok planti namel long yupela yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up in the last day.

block.text: Papa i bin salim mi na mi kam. Na i no gat wanpela man inap i kam long mi long laik bilong em yet. Nogat. Papa i mas kirapim tingting bilong en na bringim em i kam long mi. Na long las de bai mi kirapim em long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’ Therefore everyone who hears from the Father, and has learned, comes to me.

block.text: Tok i stap long buk bilong ol profet olsem, 'God bai i skulim olgeta manmeri.' Orait olgeta manmeri i harim tok bilong Papa na i kisim save long em, ol i save kam long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.

block.text: "I no gat wanpela man i bin lukim Papa. Nogat. Dispela man i bin i stap wantaim God na i kam, em tasol i bin lukim Papa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, he who believes on me has eternal life.

block.text: Tru tumas mi tokim yupela, man i bilip long mi, em i gat laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the bread of life.
Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.

block.text: Mi yet, mi bret bilong laip.
Ol dispela tumbuna bilong yupela ol i kaikai mana long ples nating, ol i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.
