ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said,

block.text: Tasol wanpela wokboi bilong hetpris, em i wanlain bilong dispela man Pita i bin katim yau bilong en, em i tok,

block.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Didn't I see you in the garden with him?”

block.text: "Ating mi bin lukim yu i stap wantaim em long gaden, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed.

block.text: Na Pita i tok gen, "Nogat." Na long dispela taim stret, kakaruk i krai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium. It was early, and they themselves didn't enter into the Praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.

block.text: Orait ol Juda i kisim Jisas na ol i lusim haus bilong Kaiafas na ol i bringim em i go long haus bilong namba wan gavman. Em i moningtaim tru. Na ol i ting, "Nogut mipela i kamap doti long ai bilong God na bai mipela i no inap kaikai abus bilong tingim De God I Larim Ol Israel I Stap Gut," olsem na ol yet i no i go insait long haus bilong namba wan gavman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore went out to them, and said,

block.text: Ol i wet i stap ausait, na Pailat i kam long ol na i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What accusation do you bring against this man?”

block.text: "Yupela i laik kotim dispela man long wanem samting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Na ol i bekim tok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If this man weren't an evildoer, we wouldn't have delivered him up to you.”

block.text: "Sapos em i no man bilong mekim pasin nogut, orait mipela i no inap bringim em i kam long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore said to them,

block.text: Na Pailat i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law.”

block.text: "Yupela kisim em i go na kotim em long lo bilong yupela yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Jews said to him,

block.text: Na ol Juda i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”

block.text: "I tambu long mipela i kilim wanpela man i dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying by what kind of death he should die.

block.text: Bipo Jisas i bin tok long pasin em bai i dai long en, na dispela samting i kamap bilong mekim tok bilong en i kamap tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to him,

block.text: Orait Pailat i go insait gen long haus gavman. Na em i singautim Jisas i kam, na i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: "Yu king bilong ol Juda, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?”

block.text: "Yu yet yu tingim na yu mekim dispela tok, o ol arapela man i bin tokim yu long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate answered,

block.text: Na Pailat i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I'm not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Mi wanpela Juda, a? Lain bilong yu yet wantaim ol bikpris ol i bringim yu i kam long mi. Yu bin mekim wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Orait Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn't be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.”

block.text: "Kingdom bilong mi em i no bilong dispela graun. Sapos kingdom bilong mi em i bilong dispela graun, orait inap ol wokman bilong mi i pait, na i no gat wanpela man inap putim mi long han bilong ol Juda. Tasol kingdom bilong mi em i no bilong dispela graun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore said to him,

block.text: Na Pailat I askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you a king then?”

block.text: "Olsem na i tru yu wanpela king, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”

block.text: "Dispela tok bilong king, em tok bilong yu yet. Mama i karim mi na mi kam long dispela graun bilong mekim wanpela wok tasol, em bilong autim tok tru, bai olgeta manmeri i ken harim. Na olgeta man i bihainim tok tru, ol i save harim tok bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to him,

block.text: Na Pailat i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is truth?”

block.text: "Tok tru, em wanem samting tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them,

block.text: Pailet I tok pinis na em i go ausait gen long ol Juda.Na em I tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I find no basis for a charge against him.

block.text: "Mi no painim wanpela rong long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Therefore do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: Tasol yupela i save long dispela pasin mi save bihainim. Long olgeta yia long dispela bikpela de bilong lotu, mi save larim yupela i makim wanpela man i ken lusim kalabus na i go fri. Olsem na ating yupela i laik bai mi lusim dispela king bilong ol Juda i go long yupela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they all shouted again, saying,

block.text: Na ol i singaut gen olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not this man, but Barabbas!”

block.text: "Em nogat. Yu mas lusim Barabas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Barabbas was a robber.

block.text: Barabas em i wanpela man bilong pait na stil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 19
So Pilate then took Jesus, and flogged him.

block.text: Orait na Pailat i tok na ol i kisim Jisas na wipim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, and put it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment.
They kept saying,

block.text: Na ol soldia i kisim ol rop i gat nil na wokim samting olsem hat bilong king, na ol i putim long het bilong em. Na ol i putim wanpela retpela klos long em.
Na ol i kam klostu long em na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hail, King of the Jews!”

block.text: "Gude, king bilong ol Juda!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they kept slapping him.
Then Pilate went out again, and said to them,

block.text: Na ol i solapim em.
Na Pailat i go ausait gen na i tokim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I bring him out to you, that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”

block.text: "Lukim, mi bai bringim em i kam ausait long yupela, na bai yupela i ken save, mi no painim wanpela rong long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i kam ausait. Dispela hat ol i wokim long rop I gat nil, em i stap yet long het bilong en. Na dispela retpela klos em tu i stap long en. Na Pailat i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the man!”

block.text: "Lukim. Em hia dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they shouted, saying,

block.text: Orait ol bikpris na ol plisman i lukim em na ol i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify! Crucify!”

block.text: "Kilim em! Kilim em! Nilim em long diwai kros!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Na Pailat i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.”

block.text: "Yupela yet kisim em na nilim em long diwai kros. Mi no painim wanpela rong long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews answered him,

block.text: Tasol ol Juda i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.”

block.text: "Mipela i gat wanpela lo, na dispela lo i tok, dispela man i mas i dai. Long wanem, em i bin tok olsem, 'Mi Pikinini Bilong God.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore Pilate heard this saying, he was more afraid.

block.text: Pailat i harim dispela tok na em i pret moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus,

block.text: Na em i go insait gen long haus bilong gavman, na em i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where are you from?”

block.text: "Yu bilong wanem ples?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus gave him no answer.
Pilate therefore said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i no bekim wanpela tok long em.
Orait Pailat i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aren't you speaking to me? Don't you know that I have power to release you, and have power to crucify you?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Yu no laik bekim tok bilong mi, a? Mi gat strong inap long lusim yu, na mi gat strong inap long nilim yu long diwai kros. Ating yu no save long dispela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Na Jisas I bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin.”

block.text: "Sapos God i stap antap em i no bin givim strong long yu, orait yu bai i no gat strong inap long daunim mi. Olsem na man I bin putim mi long han bilong yu, sin bilong dispela man em i winim sin bilong yu na em i bikpela moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: At this, Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying,

block.text: Pailat i harim dispela tok na em i wok long painim rot bilong lusim Jisas i go. Tasol ol Juda insingaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you release this man, you aren't Caesar's friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”

block.text: "Sapos yu lusim dispela man i go, orait yu no pren bilong Sisar. Man i tok long em yet em i king, em i birua bilong Sisar."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called “The Pavement,” but in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.”

block.text: Pailat i harim dispela tok, na em i bringim Jisas i go ausait. Na em i sindaun long sia bilong jas, long wanpela ples ol I kolim Plua Ston. Long tok Hibru ol i kolim Gabata.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews,

block.text: Dispela de em i de bilong redim ol kaikai samting bilong Bikpela De Bilong Tingim De God I Larim Ol Israel I Stap Gut. Na em i olsem 12 klok belo. Na Pailat i tokim ol Juda,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your King!”

block.text: "Lukim king bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cried out,

block.text: Na ol I singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!”

block.text: "Rausim em! Rausim em i go! Nilim em long diwai kros!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Na Pailat i askim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Shall I crucify your King?”

block.text: "Yupela i laik bai mi nilim king bilong yupela long diwai kros?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests answered,

block.text: Na ol bikpris i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have no king but Caesar!”

block.text: "Mipela i no gat narapela king. Sisar wanpela tasol!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then he delivered him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led him away.

block.text: Olsem na Pailat i givim Jisas long han bilong ol, bai ol I ken nilim em long diwai kros.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called “The Place of a Skull”, which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha”.

block.text: Orait na ol i kisim Jisas i go. Na em yet i karim diwai kros bilong en, na em i lusim taun na i go long wanpela hap graun ol i kolim Bun Bilong Het. Long tok Hibru ol i kolim Golgota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There they crucified him, along with two others, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle.

block.text: Long dispela hap ol i hangamapim em long diwai kros. Na ol i hangamapim tupela arapela man wantaim em, long hap na long hap. Na Jisas i stap namel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. There was written, “JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

block.text: Na tu, Pailat i tok na ol i raitim wanpela tok na putim long diwai kros. Dispela tok i olsem, "Jisas bilong Nasaret, king bilong ol Juda."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

block.text: Pailat i tokim ol long raitim dispela tok long tok Hibru na long tok Rom na long tok Grik. Ples ol i hangamapim Jisas long diwai kros, em i stap klostu long taun, olsem na planti Juda i kam lukim na ol i ritim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate,

block.text: Olsem na ol bikpris bilong ol Juda i tokim Pailat olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘he said, I am King of the Jews.’”

block.text: "Yu no ken raitim olsem, 'King bilong ol Juda.' Nogat. Yu mas raitim tok olsem, 'Dispela man i bin tok, "Mi king bilong ol Juda.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate answered,

block.text: Na Pailat i bekim tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What I have written, I have written.”

block.text: "Maski. Tok mi raitim pinis em i mas i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat.

block.text: Ol soldia i nilim Jisas pinis long diwai kros, na ol i kisim ol klos bilong en, na ol i tilim long 4 -pela hap. Na ol wan wan soldia i kisim wanpela wanpela hap. Na ol i kisim siot bilong en tu, na ol soldia i lukim olsem ol i no bin kisim planti hap laplap na samapim bilong wokim dispela siot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
Then they said to one another,

block.text: Nogat. Ol i bin wokim long wanpela laplap tasol, na ol i no bin samapim.
Olsem na ol soldia i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be,”

block.text: "Yumi no ken brukim dispela siot. Nogat. Yumi mas pilai satu bilong makim wanem man bai i kisim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which says,

block.text: Orait ol i mekim olsem, na long dispela pasin ol inapim wanpela tok i stap long buk bilong God. Dispela tok i olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They parted my garments among them. For my cloak they cast lots.”

block.text: "Ol i tilim klos bilong mi, na ol i kisim. Na ol I pilai satu bilong makim man i ken kisim saket bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the soldiers did these things.

block.text: Em dispela pasin tasol ol soldia i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

block.text: Mama bilong Jisas wantaim susa bilong en na Maria, em meri bilong Klopas, na Maria bilong taun Makdala, ol dispela meri i sanap i stap klostu long diwai kros bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother,

block.text: Jisas i lukim mama bilong en wantaim dispela disaipel em i laikim tumas, tupela i sanap klostu. Na Jisas i tokim mama olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, behold your son!”

block.text: "Meri, dispela man em i pikinini bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to the disciple,

block.text: Na em i tokimdispela disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother!”

block.text: "Dispela meri em i mama bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

block.text: Na stat long dispela taim dispela disaipel i kisim Maria i go long haus bilong en na i lukautim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said,

block.text: Orait Jisas i save, olgeta wok bilong en I pinis nau. Na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am thirsty.”

block.text: "Nek bilong mi i drai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

block.text: Em i mekim dispela tok na em inapim wanpela tok i stap long buk bilong God.

Wanpela sospen i gat wain em i stap klostu. Olsem na ol i kisim wanpela spans na putim long wain. Na taim wain i pulap long en, ol i pasim long han bilong diwai hisop na ol i putim i go long maus bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said,

block.text: Jisas i dring dispela wain pinis, orait em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is finished.”

block.text: "Em I pinis nau,"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

block.text: na em i daunim het na i lusim spirit bilong en i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn't remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

block.text: Em i de bilong redim ol samting bilong de Sabat. Dispela de Sabat em i bikpela de tru, olsem na ol Juda i no laik bai ol bodi i stap long diwai kros long dispela de. Olsem na ol i tokim Pailat long brukim lek bilong ol man i stap long diwai kros, bai ol i ken dai hariap na ol i ken rausim bodi bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him;

block.text: Orait ol soldia i go na ol i brukim lek bilong dispela tupela man ol i bin hangamapim wantaim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn't break his legs.

block.text: Tasol taim ol i kamap long Jisas, ol i lukim em i dai pinis. Olsem na ol i no brukim lek bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

block.text: Tasol wanpela soldia i sutim sait bilong Jisas long spia. Na wantu blut wantaim wara i kapsait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe.

block.text: Man i lukim dispela, em i tokaut pinis long samting em i lukim. Na dispela tok em i autim, em i tru. Na em yet i save em i tok tru. Olsem na yupela i ken bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled,

block.text: Ol dispela samting i mekim wanpela tok i stap long buk bilong God i kamap tru.Dispela tok i olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A bone of him will not be broken.”

block.text: "Bai ol i no brukim wanpela bun bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again another Scripture says,

block.text: Na narapela tok i stap long buk bilong God, em i olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They will look on him whom they pierced.”

block.text: "Bai ol i lukluk long dispela man ol i bin sutim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate:

block.text: Orait bihain Josep bilong Arimatea i go askim Pailat long larim em

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May I take Jesus’ body for burial?”

block.text: i kisim bodi bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.

block.text: Josep em i wanpela disaipel bilong Jisas, tasol em i pret long ol Juda na em i haitim bilip bilong en. Pailat i tok orait long em, olsem na Josep i go kisim bodi bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.

block.text: Na Nikodemus, em dispela man pastaim em i bin i kam lukim Jisas long nait, em tu i kam. Em i bringim sampela sanda i gat gutpela smel, ol i bin wokim long blut bilong tupela kain diwai, em ol i bin tanim wantaim. Hevi bilong dispela sanda em inap 30 kilogram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took Jesus’ body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

block.text: Josep na Nikodemus tupela i kisim bodi bilong Jisas, na putim dispela sanda long en, na karamapim long ol gutpela laplap, olsem ol Juda i save mekim long bodi bilong ol man i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid.

block.text: Klostu long dispela hap ol soldia i bin hangamapim Jisas long diwai kros, i gat wanpela gaden i stap. Na long dispela gaden i gat wanpela nupela matmat i stap, em ol i no bin putim bodi bilong wanpela man long en yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then because of the Jews’ Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

block.text: Em i de bilong ol Juda i redim ol samting bilong de Sabat, na dispela matmat i stap klostu. Olsem na tupela i karim bodi bilong Jisas i go putim long dispela matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 20
Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

block.text: Long namba wan de bilong wik, Maria bilong Makdala em i kam long matmat long moningtaim tru, taim em i tudak yet. Na em i lukim ston i no i stap long dua bilong matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them,

block.text: Olsem na em i ran i go long Saimon Pita na long dispela arapela disaipel, Jisas i bin laikim em tumas, na Maria i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have laid him!”

block.text: "Ol i rausim Bikpela pinis long matmat, na mipela i no save, wanem hap ol i putim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.

block.text: Olsem na Pita wantaim dispela arapela disaipel, tupela i lusim ples na i go long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first.

block.text: Tupela i ran i go wantaim, tasol dispela arapela disaipel em i winim Pita, na em i kamap pastaim long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn't enter in.

block.text: Em i lindaun na i lukluk i go insait long matmat, na em i lukim ol dispela gutpela laplap ol i bin karamapim bodi bilong Jisas long en. Tasol em i no i go insait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,
and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

block.text: Saimon Pita i kam bihain long em, na em i go insait long matmat. Na em i lukim ol laplap i stap,

na em i lukim narapela laplap tu, em laplap ol i bin pasim het bilong Jisas long en. Dispela laplap i no i stap wantaim ol arapela laplap. Nogat. I luk olsem wanpela man i bin raunim na putim i stap long narapela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.

block.text: Orait dispela arapela disaipel i bin kamap pastaim long matmat, em tu i go insait. Na em i lukim ol dispela samting na em i bilip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as yet they didn't know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

block.text: Long dispela taim ol i no save gut yet long tok i stap long buk bilong God, long Jisas i mas kirap bek long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.

block.text: Orait tupela disaipel i go bek long ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb,

block.text: Maria i sanap i stap ausait klostu long matmat, na em i krai i stap. Em i krai yet na em i lindaun na i lukluk i go insait long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
They told her,

block.text: Na em i lukim tupela ensel i gat waitpela klos. Tupela i sindaun long dispela hap bipo bodi bilong Jisas i bin i stap long en. Wanpela i sindaun long ples bilong het, na wanpela i sindaun long ples bilong lek.
Orait tupela i askim Maria olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, why are you weeping?”

block.text: "Meri, bilong wanem yu krai?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don't know where they have laid him.”

block.text: "Ol i rausim Bikpela bilong mi, na mi no save wanem hap ol i bin putim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn't know that it was Jesus.
Jesus said to her,

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na em i tanim na i lukim Jisas i sanap i stap. Tasol Maria i no save, em Jisas.
Orait Jisas i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?”

block.text: "Meri, bilong wanem yu krai? Yu laik painim husat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him,

block.text: Maria i ting em i man bilong bosim gaden, na em i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”

block.text: "Bikman, sapos yu bin kisim em i go, yu mas tokim mi long ples yu putim em, na bai mi go kisim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Mary.”

block.text: "Maria."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She turned and said to him,

block.text: Na Maria i tanim na i tok olsem long em long tok Hibru,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabboni!”

block.text: "Rabonai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: which is to say, “Teacher!”
Jesus said to her,

block.text: Dispela tok "Rabonai" em i olsem, "Tisa."
Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't hold me, for I haven't yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

block.text: "Yu no ken holim mi, long wanem, mi no i go antap yet long Papa bilong mi. Tasol yu mas i go long ol brata bilong mi na tokim ol olsem, mi bai go antap, na mi go long Papa bilong mi na Papa bilong yupela. Na mi go long God bilong mi na God bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples:

block.text: Orait Maria bilong Makdala em i go, na em i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have seen the Lord!”,

block.text: "Mi lukim Bikpela pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and she told them what he had said to her.

block.text: Na em i tokim ol long dispela tok Jisas i bin givim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them,

block.text: Ol disaipel i pret long ol Juda, olsem na ol i lokim ol dua bilong dispela haus ol i stap long en. San i go daun pinis long dispela namba wan de bilong wik, na Jisas i kam sanap namel long ol. Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: "Bel bilong yupela i ken i stap isi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.
Jesus therefore said to them again,

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na em i soim han na sait bilong en long ol. Ol disaipel i lukim Bikpela, na bel bilong ol i amamas.
Na Jisas i tokim ol gen,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.”

block.text: "Bel bilong yupela i ken i stap isi. Papa i bin salim mi na mi kam, na olsem tasol mi salim yupela i go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them,

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na em i winim win bilong en i go long ol, na i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive the Holy Spirit!
If you forgive anyone's sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone's sins, they have been retained.”

block.text: "Yupela kisim Holi Spirit.
Sapos yupela i lusim sin bilong ol man, orait sin bilong ol bai i lus. Na sapos yupela i no lusim sin bilong ol man, orait sin bilong ol bai i stap yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn't with them when Jesus came.

block.text: Taim Jisas i kamap long ol disaipel, wanpela bilong ol 12 -pela disaipel em i no i stap wantaim ol. Em Tomas, narapela nem bilong en Didimus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The other disciples therefore said to him,

block.text: Orait ol arapela disaipel i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have seen the Lord!”

block.text: "Mipela i lukim Bikpela pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Tasol Tomas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”

block.text: "Sapos mi no lukim mak bilong ol nil ol i bin putim long han bilong em, na sapos mi no putim pinga bilong mi i go long mak bilong ol nil, na sapos mi no putim han bilong mi i go long sait bilong en, orait mi no ken bilip. Nogat tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the midst, and said,

block.text: Long 7 -pela de bihain, ol disaipel bilong Jisas i stap insait gen, na Tomas i stap wantaim ol. Ol i lokim olgeta dua pinis, tasol Jisas i kam sanap namel long ol. Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: "Bel bilong yupela i ken i stap isi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to Thomas,

block.text: Orait na em i tokim Tomas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don't be unbelieving, but believing.”

block.text: "Yu kam putim pinga bilong yu hia, na yu lukim han bilong mi. Na yu putim han bilong yu i kam stret long sait bilong mi. Maski long tubel long bilip. Yu mas bilip tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thomas answered him,

block.text: Na Tomas i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Lord and my God!”

block.text: "Yu Bikpela bilong mi. Yu God bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.”

block.text: "Yu lukim mi pinis na yu bilip, a? Ol man i no lukim mi na ol I bilip, ol dispela man i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

block.text: Jisas i wokim planti arapela mirakel o mak tu long ai bilong ol disaipel, na mi no raitim olgeta long dispela buk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

block.text: Tasol dispela tok mi raitim, em mi raitim bai yupela i ken bilip long Jisas em dispela man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en. Em i Pikinini Bilong God. Na sapos yupela i bilip, orait bai yupela i kisim laip long nem bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 21
After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way.

block.text: Bihain Jisas i kamap gen long ol disaipel klostu long raunwara Galili, narapela nem bilong en raunwara Taiberias. Em i kamap long ol olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together.
Simon Peter said to them,

block.text: Saimon Pita na Tomas, narapela nem bilong en Didimus, na Nataniel bilong taun Kana long Galili, na tupela pikinini bilong Sebedi, na tupela arapela disaipel bilong Jisas, ol i stap wantaim.
Na Saimon Pita i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I'm going fishing.”

block.text: "Mi bai go painim pis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Na ol i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are also coming with you.”

block.text: "Mipela tu bai i go wantaim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing.

block.text: Orait ol ikalap long wanpela bot na ol i go. Tasol long dispela nait ol i no kisim wanpela pis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn't know that it was Jesus.
Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: San i laik kamap, na ol i lukim Jisas i sanap i stap long nambis. Tasol ol disaipel i no save olsem, em Jisas.
Orait Jisas i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Children, have you anything to eat?”

block.text: "Ol pikinini, ating yupela i gat sampela pis?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Na ol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No.”

block.text: "Nogat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.”

block.text: "Yupela tromoi umben long han sut bilong bot, na bai yupela i kisim sampela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cast it therefore, and now they weren't able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.

block.text: Olsem na ol i tromoi umben i go daun, na ol i kisim planti pis moa, na ol i no inap pulim umben i kam antap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter,

block.text: Dispela disaipel Jisas i laikim tumas, em i tokim Pita olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It's the Lord!”

block.text: "Em Bikpela tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.

block.text: Saimon Pita i bin lusim saket na i mekim wok. Na taim em harim dispela tok, "Em Bikpela," em i pasim saket na i kalap i go daun long wara na swim i go long nambis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.

block.text: Na ol arapela disaipel ol i kam long bot, na ol i pulim umben i kam wantaim ol pis. Ol i no bin i stap longwe long nambis. Ol i stap samting olsem 100 mita tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Ol i kam sua pinis, na ol i lukim wanpela paia i stap. Na wanpela pis i stap long paia, na bret tu i stap.
Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”

block.text: "Dispela ol pis nau yupela i kisim, em yupela kisim sampela i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn't torn.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Olsem na Saimon Pita i kalap long bot na i pulim umben i kam antap long nambis. Ol bikpela pis i pulap long umben, inap 153 pis olgeta. Ol pis i planti tumas, tasol umben i no bruk.
Orait Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and eat breakfast.”

block.text: "Yupela kam kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord.

block.text: Na ol disaipel i pret, na i no gat wanpela i askim em, "Yu husat?" Ol i save pinis, em Bikpela tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

block.text: Na Jisas i go klostu long paia na i kisim bret na i givim ol. Na em i kisim pis tu na givim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

block.text: Dispela em i namba 3 taim Jisas i kamap long ol disaipel, bihain long em i kirap pinis long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter,

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i kaikai pinis, orait Jisas i askim Saimon Pita olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?”

block.text: "Saimon, pikinini bilong Jon, ating yu laikim mi moa yet na laik bilong yu i winim laik bilong ol dispela man, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: na Pita i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: "Yes, Bikpela, yu save, mi laikim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my lambs.”

block.text: "Yu lukautim ol pikinini sipsip bilong mi long kaikai samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him again a second time,

block.text: Namba 2 taim Jisas i askim em gen,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?”

block.text: "Saimon, pikinini bilong Jon, ating yu laikim mi, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na Pita i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: "Yes, Bikpela, yu save, mi laikim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tend my sheep.”

block.text: "Yu was long ol sipsip bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him the third time,

block.text: Orait namba 3 taim Jisas i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?”

block.text: "Saimon, pikinini bilong Jon, ating yu laikim mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” He said to him,

block.text: Pita i bel hevi long Jisas i askim em namba 3 taim, "Ating yu laikim mi?"?" Na em i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you!”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu save long olgeta samting. Yu save, mi laikim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my sheep.
Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to.

block.text: "Yu lukautim ol sipsip bilong mi long kaikai samting.
"Tru tumas mi tokim yu, taim yu stap yangpela yet, yu save pasim let bilong yu yet na yu wokabaut long ples yu laik i go long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don't want to go.”

block.text: Tasol taim yu kamap lapun, bai yu litimapim han bilong yu, na narapela man bai i pasim let long yu na i kisim yu i go long ples yu no laik i go long en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him,

block.text: Jisas i mekim dispela tok bilong makim wanem pasin Pita bai i dai na givim biknem long God. Na bihain em i tokim Pita olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: "Yu bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?”

block.text: Pita i tanim na i lukim dispela disaipel Jisas i laikim tumas, em i bihainim tupela i kam. Em dispela man taim ol i kaikai em i bin putim het bilong en klostu long bros bilong Jisas na i askim em olsem, "Bikpela, husat bai i putim yu long han bilong ol birua?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus,

block.text: Pita i lukim em na i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what about this man?”

block.text: "Bikpela, olsem wanem long dispela man?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”

block.text: "Sapos mi laik bai em i stap inap long taim mi kam bek, ating em i samting bilong yu, a? Yu bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn't die. Yet Jesus didn't say to him that he wouldn't die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?”

block.text: Olsem na tok i go nabaut long ol brata olsem, "Dispela disaipel bai em i no inap i dai." Tasol Jisas i no bin tok long em i no inap i dai. Nogat. Em i bin tok, "Sapos mi laik bai em i stap inap long taim mi kam bek, ating em i samting bilong yu, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

block.text: Em dispela disaipel tasol, nau em i autim tok long ol dispela samting, na em i raitim dispela tok. Na yumi save, dispela tok em i autim em i tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn't have room for the books that would be written.

block.text: I gat planti arapela samting tu Jisas i bin mekim. Tasol sapos ol i laik raitim ol buk i gat tok long olgeta dispela samting wan wan, ating graun bilong yumi bai i no gat ples inap long yumi ken putim ol dispela buk.
